lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Gandy Dancer

speaker: Travis
lines: Previously on The Adventure Zone

speaker: Travis
lines: You see a pair of gloves on the table, they are workman’s gloves. At the tips of the fingers there are kind of… claws.

speaker: Ann
lines: If I tell you something, will you keep it to yourself? Me and Jeremiah got married.

speaker: Marcus
lines: It sounds like the deal is beneficial for the people making it. You’ve gotta look… bigger. I’ll make you a deal. [Augustus Here we go.] You take my place in the feeding tonight, and I can tell you who would be against it.

speaker: Gandy
lines: I have one very specific question I’m going to ask you. I’m going to want to know who the Banshee is.

speaker: Errol
lines: Sounds like y’all aren’t giving me a whole heck of a lot of choice, so, uh…

speaker: Ellis
lines: Oh, no no no, please, feel free to say no, but our employer will be very disappointed. The Banshee’s really looking forward to talking to you.

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Dust Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Should we go over clues first, or do you want to just hop right into this shit?

speaker: Justin
lines: I think it’s very useful to do the clue recap. Dad, what clues do you have, Dad? I want to start with Dad. Give me a clue.

speaker: Clint
lines: The first clue uh the, uh, is the uh…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Real quick question are all the clues going to take this long?

speaker: Clint
lines: Silver dust! On the twin scars across the abdomen, refined silver dust, which we have to assume is coming from the silver mine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the gloves, the gloves I found.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yes, the gloves with the two blades.

speaker: Justin
lines: I prefer order and method.

speaker: Travis
lines: Use your little gray cells!

speaker: Justin
lines: Use your little gray cells. The first clue Jeremiah was confused and felt betrayed when he died. Ann didn’t want Dylan to talk. Silver dust on Jeremiah’s clothes. Ann grew up with Dylan and Jeremiah. Jeremiah’s blood was on Dylan. Jeremiah was celebrating, he was drinking a lot. He was—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] He was married to Ann.

speaker: Justin
lines: He was celebrating his marriage to Ann. I did these chronologically, so that’s kinda— you kinda gave away, yeah. Liam has claw gloves with silver dust on them.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uhh, yes. All good.

speaker: Justin
lines: He was the murderer.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, so Liam was the murderer, I kinda beefed it there. Cause I could’ve just like, werewolf attacked him. Case closed. End of arc, two episodes in, but I forgot I guess. And that’s just bad detective work, but I’ve got a lot going on right now, so… Um…

speaker: Clint
lines: This Ann is not Anna, Augustus’s daughter, right?

speaker: Travis
lines: No.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No.

speaker: Justin
lines: No.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That would be fucking wild.

speaker: Travis
lines: Why would that?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Another thing, I got sort of accosted by two toughs—

speaker: Travis
lines: Approached. I would say approached.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, they were nice about it, but I was accosted by two toughs working for the Banshee, local sort of criminal ringleader in town, and Gandy got… feasted upon.

speaker: Travis
lines: Got— got fed on. Feasted makes it sound like, “Oh let’s go crazy."

speaker: Griffin
lines: Travis— you wanted a fucking hard arc, bro. You wanted a fucking dark tone I’m trying to give it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes, but I also want appropriate word choice.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, that’s fine.

speaker: Travis
lines: Words mean things, Griffin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And so that’s where we left off.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m also— I have two names for said toughs. Ellis and Blackwood, named for listeners Lucy Ellis and Ethan Blackwood.

speaker: Griffin
lines: See? Keep on tweeting folks, keep the dream alive.

speaker: Justin
lines: Ann— Anna’s full name is Anna Cardium Cash— sorry, not cashew that’s wild.

speaker: Clint
lines: Cashews!

speaker: Justin
lines: Anna Cardium Parsons.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right, where are we picking up Travy?

speaker: Travis
lines: When last we left, we’ll say that the feeding has just completed.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Ow.

speaker: Travis
lines: It was minor.

speaker: Justin
lines: Skipping the whole feeding?

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s just like eating a sandwich, you know what I mean? This is straight to business. People always want to romanticize vampire feeding, but this is just like, “I’m hungry, I made a sandwich, gobble gobble.”

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, but it’s not that much fun for the sandwich.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Maybe.

speaker: Travis
lines: You know, maybe? You don’t know? Maybe the sandwich is like, “Yay, my purpose!”

speaker: Justin
lines: “I did it. I reached the culmination of all my dreams.”

speaker: Travis
lines: “I’ve done it, I’m a sandwich.”

speaker: Justin
lines: If you’re a sandwich and you have dreams other than getting eaten, I bet your parents are like, “Oh Jeffrey…”

speaker: Travis
lines: “Stick to what you know.”

speaker: Justin
lines: “What a wonderful world that would be. I would love for you to be a district attorney also."

speaker: Clint
lines: “We should have never given you those participation medals.”

speaker: Travis
lines: “Oh, we encouraged you too much Jeremy the Sandwich.” And also Errol has been approached by Ellis and Blackwood. I would like to resolve that first.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah sure, are they carrying heat? Are they packing heat?

speaker: Travis
lines: Let’s say probably? They’re not like pointing guns at you or anything. They have so far been incredibly civil. They seem reasonable.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s kind of important, I feel like, for Errol in this situation to know if they’re packing heat. I don’t know if there’s a roll I can make.

speaker: Travis
lines: Do you have like a perception roll you could do to see if maybe you like smell gunpowder?

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s Figure Someone Out.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, yeah, go for that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This is embarrassing, I’ve been packing and I packed my dice up.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, I thought you were gonna say like Errol’s been packing heat.

speaker: Clint
lines: He’s packing.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean, he is. That is a… six plus mind I believe? Yes. And my mind is zero. I failed.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay. You suspect that they are since they work for a crime boss, but you cannot pinpoint where that would be or if they are for sure.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I say

speaker: Errol
lines: All right fellas, I can tell that you mean business. I’ve been meaning to have a— I mean I don’t want to sort of make myself sound like a big brave boy, I have been hiding out from the Banshee for a while now, so I’m a bit confused as to how the two of you found me. But gonna have to have a talk with my wizard companion about sort of the services she’s been providing. Look, I don’t want any trouble, and I know what the Banshee’s capable of, so I’ll come with. I wanna warn you, I have a weapon, I’m gonna take it out and just put thumb and forefinger all right? On the hilt, and I’m just gonna sort of toss it away, is that okay? Don’t—

speaker: Ellis
lines: You can keep your weapon.

speaker: Errol
lines: No, I know but I don’t wanna roll up to the ringleader’s house with a gun? That’s my house right there—

speaker: Ellis
lines: You are jumpy, Errol. Is everything okay? What’s—

speaker: Errol
lines: I’d like to—

speaker: Ellis
lines: Errol, what’s stressing you out?

speaker: Errol
lines: Uhh…

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughing] “What’s going on with Errol?"

speaker: Errol
lines: I’m just trying to— I’m not jumpy I’m just pragmatic, so I’m just gonna take my weapon here and toss it away.

speaker: Ellis
lines: Okay…

speaker: Griffin
lines: And I reach down and—

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, I should also clarify. Ellis is doing all the talking, Blackwood seems actually fairly uninterested in you and is just kind of looking up and down the street. You know, keeping an eye around.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure. Oh it— good. I reach down, thumb and forefinger like I promised, and grab the hilt of my— what’s it called on a gun? Not a hilt. But like—

speaker: Clint
lines: Grip.

speaker: Justin
lines: A handle?

speaker: Clint
lines: Grip.

speaker: Justin
lines: Grip. Grip, grip grip grip grip.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Grip, yeah, and I pull it out of my holster, and I fling it to the side of the street and into the community watch alarm bell.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And I think when that happens, and this is not me just sort of retroactively trying to screw you over, there is a thing on my character sheet about my neighborhood, my territory, that says “People here work hard to keep the streets safe.” And so this is sort of how I’m envisioning that being realized in the world.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And I think when the bell rings as my revolver collides with it, I think just, even though it’s a late hour, I think porch doors— or front doors open up and porch lights come on. And then there’s, you know, five or six people now probably weapons in hand, looking at this scene.

speaker: Ellis
lines: Errol, if you didn’t want to go with us, you could have just said. I gave you the option. I don’t understand— where is this? Where— Have we offended you in some way?

speaker: Errol
lines: Uh, offended’s not the right word. I— strong armed, might be maybe a little bit more accurate.

speaker: Travis
lines: He looks offended.

speaker: Ellis
lines: I— Oh, you know what? I can see… that we are bothering you, I apologize for that.

speaker: Travis
lines: He offers you a business card.

speaker: Ellis
lines: If you change your mind and you would like to speak with the Banshee, the Banshee has lots of answers. I was just looking to help. You can find us at this address, there’s instructions on the back. And we will… [laughs politely] get out of your fur. Blackwood, come along.

speaker: Travis
lines: And they head off.

speaker: Errol
lines: Bullshit, but cool. I guess false alarm everybody, you can go back to the house, I know that I did the big sort of meeting last week about not, you know, ringing the alarm bell for funsies. And maybe I did—

speaker: Travis Neighbor 1
lines: [Silly strained deep voice] Those guys seemed awful nice. They didn’t seem like they were threatening you at all.

speaker: Errol
lines: They had a threatening aura…

speaker: Travis Neighbor 2
lines: Really? ’Cause I— I came out here and they were just talking to you, I don’t—

speaker: Clint Neighbor 1
lines: Are we still having the potluck dinner?

speaker: Justin
lines: Are you as sure you’re as well-liked as you think you are here?

speaker: Young Neighbor
lines: [High-pitched voice] Errol was there some kind of issue that we weren’t aware of? ’Cause it seemed like it was just a pleasant conversation.

speaker: Errol
lines: No, listen, I used sort of my keen wolf senses and detected that they might probably could have possibly had guns.

speaker: Justin Neighbor 1
lines: I think he was just trying to get out of an awkward conversation.

speaker: Travis Neighbor 2
lines: Errol, do you not like small talk?

speaker: Justin Neighbor 1
lines: I wish I could use the bell to bounce on talks I don’t wanna have with my mother-in-law.

speaker: Mother-in-law
lines: [Shrilly gruff?] What’d you say?!

speaker: Justin Neighbor 1
lines: Apparently we’re all just ringing the bell higgledy-piggledy when we don’t wanna talk to somebody. When someone asks us to go to a movie we’ve already seen, apparently we’re just throwing guns at bells.

speaker: Travis Neighbor 3
lines: Oh, was that it Errol? Were they asking you if you would, like, house sit for ’em or something and you didn’t want to?

speaker: Clint Neighbor 1 (Clementius)
lines: You know, Errol, it is kind of funny if you think about it. You are now being accused as the boy that cried wolf.

speaker: Justin Neighbor 2
lines: Oh Clementius, another great joke from you—

speaker: Clementius
lines: Thank you, thank you.

speaker: Justin Neighbor 2
lines: You still doing stand-up at the Knuckle Hut?

speaker: Clementius
lines: I been—

speaker: Errol
lines: All right, all right—

speaker: Clementius
lines: It’s open mic night down at the saloon.

speaker: Justin Neighbor 2
lines: We gotta go there.

speaker: Errol
lines: This is great, uh, listen— Dad’s busy, so I gotta get back to work, I’m sorry for ringing the old bell.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I go pick up my revolver, kind of sheepishly.

speaker: Errol
lines: And yeah, potluck is on for Thursday, remember, somebody’s gonna need to bring some sort of gluten-free offering for Derek, so…

speaker: Young neighbor
lines: Is ambrosia gluten free?

speaker: Errol
lines: Uh, maybe. So we’ll— just do your research on that and go back to bed.

speaker: Justin Neighbor 3 (Derek)
lines: Hey it’s uh, me, Derek. Listen, I— if people forget to bring me gluten-free options is that like a bell-ringing-worthy situation? [crosstalk] Should I go ahead and ring the alarm bell?

speaker: Errol
lines: [crosstalk] No, don’t ring the bell for that Derek—

speaker: Derek
lines: If there’s no gluten-free options?

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah, I’ve set a real bad example here. All right, go back to bed, bye.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And I holster my weapon—

speaker: Derek
lines: I’m actually up for the night, mate, you wanna do something? Let’s do our own thing. Come with you, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I would love to regroup real quick, just so I can— I have the, what I believe, what Errol believes I should say, is the murder weapon. I would love to get that to my companions. I know we talked about how that process was kind of automatic, the info-sharing process, but I think it’s weird that there wasn’t any blood on it and so I’m wondering if there’s something that—

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s great, ’cause I conto— concocted in my mind this whole system of like psychic paper—

speaker: Griffin
lines: …No.

speaker: Travis
lines: Where you can write down notes and they would get it on their notepad, but this is way better. You guys go talk to each other, let’s say.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don’t want to strong arm Gandy into like spending a beat investigating these gloves or whatever, but like these are razor-sharp gloves with silver dust on them. It feels pretty, I don’t know, it would be good at least to rule out Liam.

speaker: Travis
lines: You are a werewolf with certain senses, I mean, blood—

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is true, I guess I could just—

speaker: Travis
lines: —is probably something you could detect.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, but you told me that I didn’t detect any blood on it though, is that just by looking at it?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: If I went a little bit deeper. Mmkay. I guess I could roll Bloodhound on it.

speaker: Travis
lines: I mean, even if you just wanted to go like, basic level investigate and check it out and look at it and just straight-up roll if you don’t want to do a corruption point. I mean you could— you’re not inept, you could do just kind of basic investigation.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Bloodhound doesn’t give me a corruption.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, excellent.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’ll just go ahead and do that, ’cause I don’t think that would take an hour.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well Gandy has Tracking. She has a spell called Tracking.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, that would be good if I think we need to figure out— Let me Bloodhound it and see if there’s actually blood on it.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ’Cause if there’s not, like, that would be wild. So I’ll roll Bloodhound. That is a… six? And a four, that’s a 10, plus blood is a 12.

speaker: Travis
lines: Great, so here’s what you can tell from it. There is no blood on it, but it was recently cleaned and oiled. And you know it’s been thoroughly scrubbed, and it’s fairly recent. Now whether that is because it had blood on it or because you know, Liam just takes care of his tools is unclear, but it does seem like it has been scrubbed clean in the recent past.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right, I— what this power says is I pick up a scent from whatever I do, and I can follow that scent to the person who has them. And I’m assuming I’m just kind of doing this in the street after putting Carrion Street back to bed, all embarrassed-like. Is this sit—

speaker: Travis
lines: And just so you know, Derek is still watching you sniff some gloves.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Great, great.

speaker: Travis
lines: So just like know that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, I’m being— yeah. I’m very aware of that. Is that scent— are those stink lines just leading me right back to Liam on the porch of the—

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes. I mean, these are Liam’s gloves. You have no reason, especially since the stink lines, you have no reason to think that anyone else has interacted with these.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right. Let’s— I think let’s regroup now.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, so Errol heads to the town square. Now Gandy and Gus, you do not know of Errol’s regrouping plan, so I’ll turn to you. The feeding has completed, it was brief. And what you found Gandy, is as it happened — and whether this was something on your end on or something that happened during the feeding — it kind of just blanked out that time period as it happened. You try to recall the feeding, and it just fuzzes out whenever you get close to it in your memories. Now Gus, you were there to witness, you kept an eye, you made sure it didn’t get out of hand, but it was brief. It just seemed like Slate took just enough to feed and move on.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are they still there?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, so that’s wrapping up and they got the first information about who would be interested, and the question was asked “Who is the Banshee?” And now! [dramatic gasp] I shall answer that question from Marcus.

speaker: Gandy
lines: We had an arrangement, we had a deal.

speaker: Marcus
lines: Yeah, so here’s what I know about the Banshee. The Banshee is, well, I— listen. If I had met the Banshee, I wouldn’t tell you the Banshee’s true identity, but here’s what I can tell you. The Banshee has thrived in this unincorporated territory. Business has been good for the Banshee. And I don’t— I can’t imagine the Banshee would want that to change. Now that said… times are changing, and that affects everyone, so it’s quite possible that this has been… the work of the Banshee, but it sure don’t seem like it. Seems awful sloppy and awful loud for someone like the Banshee to have done.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Oh great, I gave up what, three pints for that?

speaker: Travis
lines: What, you want me to just be like, “Oh yeah, it was Steve. Steve did it! Go get him.” Like Marcus is in a cage downstairs, he doesn’t know shit about shit!

speaker: Gandy
lines: Okay…

speaker: Travis
lines: What did you want to know?

speaker: Clint
lines: I wanted to know if it was Steve!

speaker: Travis
lines: It wa— Listen, I can tell you right now It was Steve.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let’s get him!

speaker: Clint
lines: Aha!

speaker: Travis
lines: Go get Steve. But you’ll never find— Steve is a ghost!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I ring the bell again.

speaker: Errol
lines: It was Steve!

speaker: Travis
lines: Steve is Keyser Söze. So what are you two gonna do now? If you want to just say like as you’re heading out of Slate’s home, you see Errol in the street. Save a little bit of trying to figure out why you would go looking for Errol, but I don’t know, unless you guys want to do that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, let’s have 10 minutes where we just wander down the streets of Dry River just like

speaker: Errol
lines: Gandy?

speaker: Gandy
lines: Augustus! Oh, no I know… Augustus do you have any cashews? I’m feeling really drained.

speaker: Travis
lines: He’s a ghost!

speaker: Augustus
lines: Well, no, I have ghost cashews. I actually don’t know what would happen if you attempted to eat them. I will make them manifest, though.

speaker: Gandy
lines: I will— I’ll take the chance, I’m starved.

speaker: Augustus
lines: All right. Here’s a— here you go. Ooh, one packet of the finest spectral cashews this side of the Mississippi—

speaker: Gandy
lines: Ooh, ah! Salt and pepper, oh I love these.

speaker: Augustus
lines: Yes, it’s a new flavor what you’re—

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m gonna say that you are having an intimacy moment right now.

speaker: Travis
lines: So I would like you both to do what that— what happens when you have an intimacy moment.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: So for the Spectre, when you share a moment of intimacy, physical or emotional, with another person, you hold one. Whenever they get into trouble, you can spend your hold to be there.

speaker: Justin
lines: Cool.

speaker: Clint
lines: With the Wizard, when you share a moment of intimacy, physical or emotional, with another person, decide whether you care about them or not. If you don’t, they go about their business as normal. If you do, they take negative one ongoing to escape until they get some intimacy somewhere else.

speaker: Travis
lines: So do you care about Gus?

speaker: Griffin
lines: This is a big decision to be made after the ghost cashews thing.

speaker: Travis
lines: Hey listen, you can’t introduce the idea of ghost cashews and just like, and I, the GM, am like, “Meh, I don’t care about ghost cashews.” Of course I care about ghost cashews! We’re making a moment here. And you know I think that that happens whenever someone has a delicious Parsons cashew. A moment is made.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Of ghostly cashews that were murdered in a terrible passion.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Augustus, you—

speaker: Augustus
lines: Yes?

speaker: Gandy
lines: You didn’t have to keep an eye on me during the feeding, and I really appreciate the fact that you— you were there just in case something had gone wrong. And mostly because you knew how afraid I was of death and also because I think you got a little bit of a kick out of it. But you know what?

speaker: Augustus
lines: It was both, you’re correct.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Augustus Parsons—

speaker: Augustus
lines: Fire and ice. That’s Augustus Parsons.

speaker: Gandy
lines: I care about you.

speaker: Augustus
lines: Well thank you.

speaker: Gandy
lines: I care about you.

speaker: Augustus
lines: I suddenly feel like my ability to escape has become diminished somehow.

speaker: Gandy
lines: That’s love. That— that is—

speaker: Augustus
lines: Indeed.

speaker: Gandy
lines: That is love in all of its forms and definitions.

speaker: Augustus
lines: And you Gandy, you have my marker. If ever you should need me, I can assure you I will be there.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Well the cashews go a long way towards taking care of that. But I just want you to know I—

speaker: Augustus
lines: Do you want to see something really cool? The really neat part?

speaker: Justin
lines: And he digs in his pocket.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Yes! Yes.

speaker: Augustus
lines: More! See there are more, I just—

speaker: Gandy
lines: Oh!

speaker: Augustus
lines: They’re spectral cashews, so you will not receive any nutrition from them, but it is a repeatable trick of mine.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Amazing!

speaker: Griffin
lines: So let’s go over clues.

speaker: Travis
lines: We did that already, so if we want to do like the propeller spin. And that’s where we’re at—

speaker: Justin
lines: What was— can we actually go over the earlier clues? My clues were just from the last episode. So if we have any, like, earlier stuff that we think might be germane.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think we got everything actually.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, the silver dust and Dylan’s thing, “she” wouldn’t want him to talk. That’s— well I have actually also been keeping track of what I know versus what you find out.

speaker: Justin
lines: Would it be worth, like, should we try to… Let me ask you this, Travis, are we at a point now where we can have a conversation and try to piece together…?

speaker: Travis
lines: Absolutely.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay. I think—

speaker: Travis
lines: I think that would make for good radio.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let’s have that scene. Yeah. Okay so let’s regroup now that everybody’s all cashewed up.

speaker: Clint
lines: Mm!

speaker: Travis
lines: Is that how Errol sounds?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, no that’s how Griffin sounds.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: So who’s cashew— so Griffin McElroy, Griffin Andrew McElroy, Andy to his friends, is saying to me, Justin, that I’m cashewed up.

speaker: Clint
lines: Tyler to his friends.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yes. Ty-ty Baby.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um… yeah. So I imagine we’re like around the Black Maria at this point, sort of in the town square.

speaker: Augustus
lines: So who— After reviewing all this information, who are our possible suspects? I think Liam is an obvious choice.

speaker: Errol
lines: Uh, yeah I mean these are Liam’s gloves, and I don’t know, they seem to fit the ah— seem to fit the murder weapon description as we know it, with the razor-sharp claws and the dust from the local silver mine. Seems likely. I haven’t really pressed— put the irons to Liam yet for finding out whether or not he done it, but might be worth circling back there. Ann swears up and down that he’s a good dude, but I don’t know. She might be a little too close to make a judgement call.

speaker: Augustus
lines: Good dudes do terrible things all the time.

speaker: Errol
lines: That’s fair.

speaker: Gandy
lines: I think we need to figure out motive. It seems like every time we start to establish a motive, it gets turned around. I mean, we had this idea about the deal coming together, and how everybody will benefit from it. But we have yet to find somebody who wouldn’t benefit from it. I— I think motive is very important. We need to figure out what the motive would be for someone to kill him.

speaker: Augustus
lines: Obviously there’s unrest. And keeping those mines separate is a huge one. There could also be jealousy of this new betrothal. I’m not sure who that would necessarily point the finger towards, I don’t have a good suggestion there.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Could it be that— so that would be concern of the heart, right?

speaker: Augustus
lines: Perhaps, yes.

speaker: Errol
lines: Here’s what I’m stumped about. I think we can rule out the fact that Dylan just killed Jeremiah because he didn’t like him. I think what we know now, Dylan probably didn’t do it. At least not for the reasons that we assumed at first glance. Problem is, if this was a business thing, someone needed to know where Dylan was gonna be and where Jeremiah would be in order to stage this thing the way they wanted it to.

speaker: Augustus

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah… That is a five and a two, another seven. I have zero mind. “On a seven to nine, pick two. You create an opportunity, you expose a weakness or flaw, you confuse them for some time, or you avoid further engagement.” Um… I want to say maybe create an opportunity and confuse them for some time maybe?

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay. What opportunity would you like to create?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Is the opportunity for my friends to remain concealed on the table?

speaker: Travis
lines: Sure, yeah, we’ll go with that for some time.

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah, I uh, listen, we’re in the middle of kind of a big job right now, and we’re kind of—

speaker: Banshee
lines: Oh, I know! Yes! I know.

speaker: Errol
lines: So we’re trying to split up, cover more ground… you probably know.

speaker: Banshee
lines: Yes, makes sense.

speaker: Errol
lines: You probably know what it’s like on the other side. We’re trying to do is solve this crime, so— I think they’re over at Silver’s place right now? So I’m here to talk to you alone, I figure whatever you got I can probably handle.

speaker: Banshee
lines: Okay. Well, listen. Let’s get down to business. I want to help you in this. I want to help you solve this. I want the deal between the Furs and the Fangs and the workers, I want it to go through.

speaker: Errol
lines: Now… okay. Is this like a “big fish in a small pond looking for the pond to get bigger” kind of thing?

speaker: Banshee
lines: No, well… that might be part of it, but here’s the thing. I welcome structure, Mr. Ryehouse. Chaos thrives against structure. Do you understand? If everything is chaos, no one seeks me out, no one needs vice if everything’s chaos, they seek structure. That’s why in times of upset and fraught tension, that’s why people turn to The Church and turn to leadership and seek out structure. But when everything is rigid, that’s when people seek out vice. That’s when my business thrives! I want this to go— I want the territory to be incorporated, then I‘ll have more opportunity for vice. Do you understand?

speaker: Errol
lines: I know the way of things probably better than you assume that I do. We… we create worlds and then folks like you find opportunities inside of ‘em, and then it’s back up to folks like us to try to squash you before you can do any real irreparable harm. I—

speaker: Errol
lines: Oh, it’s funny?

speaker: Banshee
lines: No, sorry. Go on.

speaker: Errol
lines: I assume that something like this wasn’t really your MO, slicing a guy down in the middle of the streets.

speaker: Banshee
lines: I would never! So…ugh, obvious.

speaker: Errol
lines: I mean you would, let’s— you definitely would, but you would do a better job of it.

speaker: Banshee
lines: Yes, thank you, I do take some pride in my work.

speaker: Errol
lines: Yeah, this— you’ve gotta understand, this situation’s mighty uncomfortable for me. I'm not a fan of the stuff you do here.

speaker: Banshee
lines: I— listen, I understand. I— this is— what we have here is kind of a mutual opportunity. This is— I— listen. You are an agent of order and law and blehh. I don’t agree with your methods, we don’t see eye-to-eye on that, I understand, but this is mutually beneficial for us. I will give you information to help your investigation, and in turn I— the structure will continue to grow in this area and so my chaos will thrive.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The hairs on Errol’s neck this whole time are fucking standing on end. Like, I— this— I want to sort of wave away any sort of narrative dissonance here because Errol’s whole shit is like trying to stop folks like this from hurting the people who they kind of prey upon. But at this point, like, he’s so desperate to keep Dylan alive that I think he’s probably willing to like bend the rules a little bit.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well let me make it a little easier for you!

speaker: Banshee
lines: You know what? Mr. Ryehouse, this is important to me, so I’ll sweeten the pot. You agree to accept my help, and in return I will owe you a small favor. Small. Do you understand? It will be up to me to determine that favor if you ever request it. But I will be in…your debt.

speaker: Errol
lines: We’re trying to solve one murder. And we’re doing it to try to clear the name of a good guy who found himself in the wrong place at the wrong time. It occurs to me now, sitting here across from you, that you have done many murders, not you yourself. I get that it’s not your style, heck I don’t know if you’ve ever actually killed anybody before, yourself. But what I’m doing now is trying to weigh sort of the… cost-benefit sort of analysis of what dealing with you loses me.

speaker: Banshee
lines: Mr. Ryehouse, I can tell you’re a little hesitant. So let me— I will make you an offer. We will work together on this for but a moment, I will give you the information you need and then we needn't talk again. Or. I could, mmm…let’s see…I know that there’s the Black Mariah sitting in town square unguarded currently, if I’m not mistaken. I could maybe buy up all of Carrion Street and foreclose it. Or I could take ownership of that little cashew company your friend owns and close its doors. So those are your options 1. We help each other, 2. I destroy the things you and your friends care about.

speaker: Justin
lines: I think as Errol continues to struggle with this decision, Augustus materializes.

speaker: Banshee
lines: Oh!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh-oh!

speaker: Banshee
lines: Mr. Parsons! Pleasure to meet you as well.

speaker: Errol
lines: I was goofing earlier, sorry.

speaker: Banshee
lines: I— listen. If I’m being honest, I’m not surprised.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Well how does this surprise you?

speaker: Clint
lines: Gandy visualizes— materializes on the other side.

speaker: Banshee
lines: Miss Dancer! What a twist, huh? All three of you here, how could I ever have antici— anyways, what were you saying?

speaker: Augustus
lines: Well, I— you of course know the fortunes of the Augustus Parsons Cashew Company have gone south under the leadership of Mr. Garrett Althiser, who has compromised the company. I… understand you're threatening to buy the company, and I— at that point if you were to do that, I would have no chance of reassuming control, which I am still fully capable of doing even in my spectral form, of the company. And I would love to take you up on your offer. Let us be partners in this. You seem a decent businessperson, much as myself, and I would be honored to work with someone of your caliber and gravitas.

speaker: Banshee
lines: Excellent!

speaker: Errol
lines: Not the other st— she’s not gonna buy Carrion Street, that ain't happening—

speaker: Banshee
lines: No, listen! I just wanted someone to say yes.

speaker: Travis
lines: And she slides an envelope across to you. And it soon as it reaches the front of you, the spirit that has been occupying the body in front of you leaves it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, fuck.

speaker: Travis
lines: Leaving behind the corpse of the old woman it was using to speak with you. And the Banshee is gone from the room.

speaker: Clint
lines: Nice disguise!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I— I say

speaker: Errol
lines: Shit. I’m sorry guys, I blew that one. That was— I knew we came here for information, that was the closest I ever got to closing a chapter on my life that I— I let it get to me, and I’m— I’m sorr—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are the other two folks still there?

speaker: Travis
lines: I mean, you can look.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I look, are they still there?

speaker: Travis
lines: They’re gone.

speaker: Errol
lines: Uh, I let it get to me, and I let it distract me and I screwed the pooch on that one.

speaker: Gandy
lines: Errol, Errol, we were all— I was pissed. She threatened my Black Maria, she threatened Uncle Oni. No, that will not stand!

speaker: Errol
lines: All right, I guess let’s see what we got out of this.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And I open up the envelope.

speaker: Travis
lines: So you open the envelope. A key falls out, a house key [theme music fades in]. You pull out the piece of paper that’s in there, and on one side is written an address. A local address, you can tell it’s here in Dry River, not far from where you are now. And when you turn it over, it simply says, “Don’t trust Connors.”

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Dust Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]
